text: On 9 August 2024, Voepass Linhas Aéreas Flight 2283, an ATR 72-500 Brazilian domestic flight from Cascavel to Guarulhos, crashed in Vinhedo, São Paulo State. The plane was flying at an altitude of before to stalling and spun with a rapid descent at around 13:22 BRT. All 62 people on board died. The crash was the deadliest aviation accident in Brazil since TAM Airlines Flight 3054 in July 2007. Aviation experts believe that ice buildup could have been a reason for the crash. President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva was at an event in the south of the country when he received news of the crash and asked for a moment of silence at the event for those on board. Later that evening, he declared three days of national mourning in response to the crash. ==References== Category:2024 in South America Category:2020s in Brazil Category:Aviation accidents and incidents in 2024 Category:Aviation accidents and incidents in South America Category:August 2024 events Category:São Paulo (state)
title: Voepass Linhas Aéreas Flight 2283
